node.title: Read Dave Portnoy's Full Response to Accusations of Being a 'Sexual Deviant'
node.alt: Barstool founder Dave Portnoy denied allegations of sexual misconduct on Thursday, but acknowledged he has no way to prove his innocence in one of the cases because it's a case of he said, she said. Above, Portnoy visits Faction Talk at SiriusXM Studios on November 14, 2017, in New York City.
node.description: The Barstool Sports founder denied he's ever done anything unseemly with a woman and accused the reporter of digging up dirt to fit a narrative that she already had in mind.
node.content:
["Barstool Sports founder Dave Portnoy denied allegations made by two women that he had non-consensual sex with them\u2014including one woman who said she was so depressed after sleeping with him that she had to be hospitalized.", "On Thursday, Business Insider reported that multiple unnamed women had met up with Portnoy at his Nantucket home and allegedly engaged in sexual encounters that turned violent and humiliating. One accuser described feeling like a \"human sex doll\" and that she was \"literally screaming in pain,\" while another woman said she became depressed to the point where her mother called the police.", "Portnoy denied he's ever engaged in sexual conduct that was non-consensual. He said in an 11-minute video posted on Twitter that the first time he was aware of anything \"unseemly\" about the two encounters was when the Business Insider piece was published.", "He accused the reporter of developing a narrative before even writing the article and spending months digging until she found stories that fit the piece she wanted to write.", "The Barstool Sports founder included direct messages with one of the women from after they slept together, using it as evidence that her allegations against him weren't true. He said he had no way to prove his innocence in the other encounter because it was a \"he said/she said\" situation.", "", "
Barstool founder Dave Portnoy denied allegations of sexual misconduct on Thursday, but acknowledged he has no way to prove his innocence in one of the cases because it's a case of he said, she said. Above, Portnoy visits Faction Talk at SiriusXM Studios on November 14, 2017, in New York City.
", "You can read his full response below:"]
